title: THE HOPKINS TOUCH font?
content:
anyone know what the font used for this title is 'the hopkins touch'?  
thanks, much appreciated...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014193632im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-06-16%20at%201_6729.57.39%20PM.png)
author: vanpat

comments.content: looks like [Fairfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014193632/http:/www.fonts.com/font/linotype/fairfield?isRatingExpanded=False#product_44914), medium italic mixed with swash.
indeed, I think you're right. many thanks!

Rudolph Ruzicka designed Fairfield as a text font inspired by Venetian Old Face types over a ten year period starting in 1939. The medium weight, as shown in the sample image, was released in 1947. Alex Kaczun redesigned Fairfield for Linotype-Hell -- I believe he added the elegant flourished capital letters and the other alt letters -- which released it in digital form in 1992.  
Don
